Entities.Name: Wound - Type
Entities.Definition: The nature of the wound (e.g., wound, ulcer, incision, blister, etc.).

Entities.Name: Wound - Pressure Ulcer Stage
Entities.Definition: The documented stage of a pressure ulcer, such as stage I, stage III, or unstageable.

Entities.Name: Wound - Size
Entities.Definition: The dimensions of the wound including length, width, and depth if available.

Entities.Name: Wound - Anatomic Location
Entities.Definition: The anatomical position of the wound on the patient's body.

Entities.Name: Wound - Treatment
Entities.Definition: Details of wound treatment interventions including medications, dressings, procedures.

Dataset.Name: Partners Healthcare Clinical Notes
Dataset.Description: Clinical notes collected from patients with ischemic heart disease hospitalized between 2011–2013 at Partners Healthcare System. The dataset includes annotated wound cases from discharge summaries and outpatient notes.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Annotations were performed using the Knowtator tool integrated into Protégé. The wound minimum-dataset included five core elements: wound type, pressure ulcer stage, wound size, wound location, and wound treatment. The system used lexicons from SNOMED-CT, ICD-9, LOINC, and manual curation from training data.
